caption.p: HIV-1 genetic diversity impacts its susceptibility to bnAbs. As an illustration, neutralization data were gathered for four bnAbs (PGT121, PG9, 3BNC117, and 10E8), each targeting a different site of vulnerability (V3g, V1V2g, CD4bs, and MPER, respectively), tested against three panels of transmitted-founder (T/F) viruses representing clade C ( n = 200) [ 60], B ( n = 40) [ 62], and CRF02_AG ( n = 33) [ 61]. Based on individual half-maximal inhibitory concentration (IC 50) values, the percentage of viruses neutralized at the bnAb concentration of 1 Î¼g/mL within each clade is represented and highlights intersubtype discrepancies of the neutralization coverage.
